REQ-SYND-001.title: Hidden Role Assignment
REQ-SYND-001.notes: Foundational spec: assigns Loyalist/Syndicate roles at game start (90/10 split, archetype weighting). No dependencies—is a prerequisite for all other Syndicate specs.

REQ-SYND-002.title: The Revelation Moment

blockers.reason: Triggers at Turn 50 or first contract completion (REQ-SYND-003). Must verify Syndicate roles exist from REQ-SYND-001.

REQ-SYND-002.notes: Narrative turning point: reveals Syndicate exists to all players. Unlocks accusation system (REQ-SYND-007) and activates Suspicious Activity Feed (REQ-SYND-012) for Loyalists.

REQ-SYND-003.title: Syndicate Contract System

blockers.reason: Only accessible to Syndicate players; assigned in REQ-SYND-001
Contracts are tier-gated by Trust level (REQ-SYND-004). Cannot unlock Tier 2+ contracts without trust progression.
Each contract generates suspicion (REQ-SYND-006). Suspicion calculations must be available before contracts complete.

REQ-SYND-003.notes: 3 active contracts at any time, tier-gated by Trust. Completing contract reveals new option. Contract effects visible in Suspicious Activity Feed (REQ-SYND-012). Triggers Revelation Moment if first completed before Turn 50 (REQ-SYND-002).

REQ-SYND-004.title: Trust Progression System

blockers.reason: Trust only applies to Syndicate players; assigned in REQ-SYND-001

REQ-SYND-004.notes: 8 levels (0-35,000 points) unlock Black Market tiers (REQ-SYND-005) and contract tiers (REQ-SYND-003). Earned via contracts, Black Market purchases, WMDs. Decays if inactive 10 turns.

REQ-SYND-005.title: Black Market System

blockers.reason: Black Market exclusive to Syndicate players; Loyalists see denial message
All items gated by Trust level (1-8). WMDs (Trust 6+) gate restricted weapons.

REQ-SYND-005.notes: Catalog: components, advanced systems, restricted weapons (WMDs), intelligence services. Prices are 1.25×-2.0× base depending on Trust. WMD purchases add 50 trust, increase suspicion (REQ-SYND-006) significantly.

REQ-SYND-006.title: Suspicion System

blockers.reason: Suspicion tracking applies to all empires; tracks Syndicate player detection risk

REQ-SYND-006.notes: Tracks per-empire suspicion (0-100). Affected by: contracts (15-100), Black Market purchases, WMD use. Triggers: bot accusations (>60), Coordinator monitoring (>75), higher accusation success (REQ-SYND-007). Can reduce via clean turns, alliances, charity.

REQ-SYND-007.title: Accusation System

blockers.reason: Accusation trial determines if accused is Syndicate (assigned in REQ-SYND-001)
Accusation system unlocks after Revelation Moment (Turn 50)
Resolution affected by suspicion score; high suspicion increases guilty vote bias (+20%)
Accuser must spend 25 Intel Points (from REQ-SYND-011) to create accusation

REQ-SYND-007.notes: Process: accuser spends 25 Intel Points, public announcement, voting 3 turns. Outcomes: Guilty+Syndicate = outed (loses hidden status, -25% trust), Guilty+Loyalist = false accusation (accuser penalized -10k cr, -20 standing), Innocent = no change. Outed Syndicate gains 'Desperate' status (+20% combat, -20% income).

REQ-SYND-008.title: The Coordinator (NPC Faction)

blockers.reason: Coordinator validates if target is truly Syndicate; requires loyalty assignment
Coordinator standing affects accusation success; coordinates with accusation system
Coordinator reports cost 15 Intel Points (from REQ-SYND-011)

REQ-SYND-008.notes: Services: Intel Validation (15 Intel + 5k cr, reveals next contract if target is Syndicate), Protection (+10% funding), Whistleblower betrayal (+25k cr, +25% funding, but trust reset to 0, Black Market revoked, Syndicate hostile with 5% assassination per turn). Defector new victory: survive Turn 200.

REQ-SYND-009.title: Syndicate Victory Conditions

blockers.reason: Victory only applies to Syndicate players; role assigned in REQ-SYND-001
Contract Mastery victory: complete 3 contracts (REQ-SYND-003). Chaos victory: 2+ contracts by Turn 200.

REQ-SYND-009.notes: Three conditions: (1) Contract Mastery (3 contracts before Turn 200, hidden='Shadow Victory', outed='Defiant Victory'), (2) Chaos Victory (Turn 200 reached, 2+ contracts, no standard victory), (3) Perfect Game (3 contracts + never detected + 'Shadow Master' achievement). Victory screen reveals operative identity, contracts, suspicion survived, trust level.

REQ-SYND-010.title: Bot Syndicate Integration

blockers.reason: Bots assigned roles (50% Schemer Syndicate) in REQ-SYND-001
Syndicate bot decision logic: contract selection, stay-hidden priorities
Bot decision logic can reference trust levels; not strictly required initially
Loyalist bot accusation logic: threshold-based (Diplomat >40 suspicion, Warlord >70, Turtle never)
Bot uses Intel Points for accusations and investigations

REQ-SYND-010.notes: Syndicate bots prioritize low-suspicion contracts until 2 VP, then go for victory. Loyalist bots accuse based on archetype thresholds. Schemer paradox: 50% Syndicate/50% Loyalist creates permanent suspicion. 70+ message templates for events.

REQ-SYND-011.title: Intel Point Economy

blockers.reason: Intel Points apply to Loyalist players; Syndicate assignment in REQ-SYND-001

REQ-SYND-011.notes: Loyalist only: earn 5 Intel per turn (max 50 stored). Spend: Investigation (10 pts, reveals suspect links), Accusation (25 pts), Coordinator Report (15 pts). Bonuses: +10 pts per successful Coordinator report, +15 pts per successful accusation. Feeds into REQ-SYND-007 (accusation cost) and REQ-SYND-008 (Coordinator cost).

REQ-SYND-012.title: Suspicious Activity Feed

blockers.reason: Feed only visible to Loyalist players; determined in REQ-SYND-001
Feed activates after Revelation Moment (Turn 50)
Feed generated from contract effects (production drops, market crashes, etc.)
Investigation reveals suspicion increase linked to event (from REQ-SYND-006 tracking)

REQ-SYND-012.notes: Shows unexplained events (production drops, market anomalies, accidents, Black Market activity). Event data: turn, affected empire, description. Investigation (10 Intel) reveals source, increases suspect suspicion. Generates Suspicious Activity from contract effects in REQ-SYND-003.

criticalPath.rationale: Hidden Role Assignment is the foundational spec. All other SYNDICATE specs depend on role assignment. Must implement first.
Core economy systems. Trust gates contracts/Black Market, Suspicion impacts accusations, Intel drives Loyalist gameplay. These can be parallelized after Wave 0.
Core gameplay loop. Contracts generate events visible in Activity Feed. Depends on Trust (REQ-SYND-004), Suspicion (REQ-SYND-006), roles (REQ-SYND-001).
Narrative turning point. Unlocks accusation system (Wave 4) and activates Suspicious Activity Feed (Wave 2). Triggers after contracts exist (Wave 2).
High-stakes PvP mechanics. Depends on Revelation (Wave 3), Suspicion (Wave 1), Intel (Wave 1). Can be parallelized after Wave 3.
End-game and bot integration. Victory checks contracts (Wave 2), Bot AI uses contracts/accusations (Waves 2, 4). Can be parallelized after all prerequisites complete.

VICTORY-SYSTEMS.reason: REQ-SYND-009 mentions 'standard victory conditions' for Loyalists (Conquest, Economic, Research, Military, Coalition, Survival). Syndicate Victory is alternative path, not blocking implementation but needed for context.

BOT-SYSTEM.reason: REQ-SYND-010 integrates with existing bot archetypes, messaging system, and decision logic. Can be implemented if bot system exists; bots default to non-Syndicate if system not ready.

MARKET-SYSTEM.reason: REQ-SYND-003 'Market Manipulation' contract, REQ-SYND-012 'market anomalies' assume market system exists. Can substitute with simplified market if needed.

RESEARCH-SYSTEM.reason: REQ-SYND-005 Black Market includes 'Research Espionage' (5k cr). Optional for initial implementation.

notesOnArchitecture: REQ-SYND-001 (Hidden Role Assignment) is the single point of failure. All other specs depend on it. Implementation MUST ensure roles are assigned before any other Syndicate logic runs.
SYNDICATE system is largely self-contained: 19 of 23 dependencies are intra-system (within SYNDICATE). Only 4 soft external dependencies (VICTORY, BOT, MARKET, RESEARCH).
Trust progression (REQ-SYND-004) is the 'currency' that gates access to Black Market (REQ-SYND-005) and contracts (REQ-SYND-003). It's the primary progression system for Syndicate players.
Suspicion system (REQ-SYND-006) is the primary risk metric. Affects contract generation, accusation success, bot behavior (REQ-SYND-010), and intel investigations.
Intel Points (REQ-SYND-011) are the primary currency for Loyalist gameplay: investigation, accusations, Coordinator reports.
Accusation System (REQ-SYND-007) and Coordinator (REQ-SYND-008) are the PvP mechanics that create drama and tension.
Activity Feed (REQ-SYND-012) is the information bridge: shows contract effects to Loyalists without revealing source (until investigation).
Bot Integration (REQ-SYND-010) depends on most other SYNDICATE specs being implemented first for realistic AI behavior.

implementationComplexity.REQ-SYND-003: High - Contract generation, tier gating, completion tracking, effect application, Suspicious Activity generation.
implementationComplexity.REQ-SYND-004: Medium - Trust level tracking, exponential thresholds, decay calculation.
implementationComplexity.REQ-SYND-005: Medium - Item catalog, price multiplier calculation, access control, purchase tracking.
implementationComplexity.REQ-SYND-006: Medium - Suspicion scoring formula, threshold triggers, reduction mechanics.
implementationComplexity.REQ-SYND-007: High - Accusation workflow, voting system, resolution logic with outcome branches, trial UI.
implementationComplexity.REQ-SYND-008: Medium - NPC faction logic, report validation, betrayal consequences.
implementationComplexity.REQ-SYND-009: Medium - Victory condition checks, achievement unlocking, end-game narrative screen.
implementationComplexity.REQ-SYND-010: Very High - Archetype-specific AI decision trees, message templates (70+), accusation logic, voting strategy.
implementationComplexity.REQ-SYND-011: Low - Simple Intel point accumulation, spending, capping, bonus awards.
implementationComplexity.REQ-SYND-012: Medium - Event generation from contracts, investigation mechanics, source revelation.

riskFactors.mitigation: If role distribution (90/10) creates poor game feel, entire system cascades. Recommend pre-playtesting with distribution variations (85/15, 80/20) before implementation.
REQ-SYND-006 drives accusation success (REQ-SYND-007) and bot behavior (REQ-SYND-010). If suspicion inflation/deflation broken, entire PvP system fails. Requires extensive tuning.
REQ-SYND-010 is highest complexity spec (Very High). Recommend implementing without bots initially, add bot AI in post-Beta phase.
REQ-SYND-007 (accusations) + REQ-SYND-008 (Coordinator reports) could be exploited by players to coordinate false accusations. Recommend monitoring and potential cooldown mechanics.
Market Manipulation (REQ-SYND-003) and other contracts assume external systems exist. If MARKET-SYSTEM not implemented, contracts fail. Recommend stub implementations of external systems.

recommendedImplementationOrder.rationale: Foundational. Must implement first before any other SYNDICATE logic.
Trust is the core progression system for Syndicate players. Unlock Black Market (REQ-SYND-005) and contracts (REQ-SYND-003).
Suspicion system affects contracts, accusations, bots. Must implement before gameplay mechanics can proceed.
Intel Points for Loyalists. Simple to implement, enables accusation system (REQ-SYND-007).
Black Market. Depends on Trust (REQ-SYND-004). Provides Syndicate players resource/power advantage.
Contracts. Core gameplay loop for Syndicate players. Highest complexity in implementation (contract generation, effects, completion, rewards).
Activity Feed. Depends on contract effects (REQ-SYND-003). Provides information to Loyalists.
Revelation Moment. Narrative event. Unlocks accusation system (REQ-SYND-007).
Accusation System. High complexity (voting, resolution branches, UI). Depends on Revelation (REQ-SYND-002).
Coordinator NPC. Depends on Accusation System (REQ-SYND-007). Provides late-game options.
Victory Conditions. Depends on contracts (REQ-SYND-003). End-game condition checking and narrative screen.
Bot Integration. Highest complexity. Recommend implementing late, after all player-facing systems stable. Can parallelize message templates with other specs.

implementationNotes: REQ-SYND-001 (Hidden Role Assignment) has zero internal dependencies and is blocking all other specs. This is a unique architecture that creates a tree of dependencies rooted in role assignment.
Waves can be parallelized more aggressively than suggested if multiple developers available. Wave 1 core systems (REQ-SYND-004, 005, 006, 011) are independently implementable after Wave 0.
REQ-SYND-003 (Contracts) and REQ-SYND-012 (Activity Feed) are tightly coupled but can be implemented with stubs (e.g., Activity Feed can stub contract effects until REQ-SYND-003 complete).
REQ-SYND-010 (Bot Integration) is recommended as post-Beta work due to very high complexity (40 estimated hours). Can launch without sophisticated bot AI, add dramatic bot behavior in later patch.
SYNDICATE system has minimal external dependencies compared to VICTORY system. Only 4 soft cross-system references (VICTORY, BOT, MARKET, RESEARCH).
Hard blockers: 21/23 dependencies are HARD, indicating SYNDICATE specs are very interdependent. System must be implemented as coherent unit, not piecemeal.

Total complexity: 128 estimated hours. Recommend 3-4 weeks for two developers working in parallel (Wave 0: 1 dev, Waves 1-2: both devs parallel, Waves 3-4: both devs sequential, Wave 5: 1 dev with other features).

Testing strategy: Unit tests for Trust, Suspicion, Intel Point calculations (Waves 0-1). Integration tests for Contract workflow, Accusations, Victory checks (Waves 2-4). E2E tests for full game with Syndicate player (Waves 5-6).
